intro: Sabia purpurea, commonly known as the purple sabia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers and fuzzy, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sabia purpurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
